greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array T; for n>0, row n shows the coefficients of a reduced polynomial having zeros -k/(n+1) for k=1,2,...,n.
comment: For n>0, the zeros of the polynomial represented by row n+1 interlace the zeros of the polynomial for row n; see the Example section.
example: First five rows(counting the top row as row 0):
Interlace property for successive rows illustrated by
mathematica: p[n_, x_] := Product[(n*x + k)/GCD[n, k], {k, 1, n - 1}]
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jan 08 2012
